definitions.definition: A soft, white, powdery limestone (calcium carbonate, CaCO 3 ).
examples: chalk cliffs are not recommended for climbing

definitions.definition: A piece of chalk, or nowadays processed compressed gypsum (calcium sulfate, CaSO 4 ), that is used for drawing and for writing on a blackboard ( chalkboard ).
examples: the chalk used to write on the blackboard makes a squeaky sound

definitions.definition: A white powdery substance used to prevent hands slipping from holds when climbing, or losing grip in weight-lifting or gymnastics, sometimes but not always limestone-chalk, often magnesium carbonate (MgCO 3 ).
examples: when working out your next move, it's a good idea to get some more chalk from the bag

definitions.definition: A platoon -sized group of airborne soldiers .
The favorite in a sporting event.
definitions.label_groups: US , sports , chiefly basketball , horse racing

definitions.definition: The prediction that there will be no upsets, and the favored competitor will win.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) A soft, white, powdery limestone (calcium carbonate, CaCO 3 ).
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A piece of chalk, or nowadays processed compressed gypsum (calcium sulfate, CaSO 4 ), that is used for drawing and for writing on a blackboard ( chalkboard ).

( uncountable , climbing , gymnastics ) A white powdery substance used to prevent hands slipping from holds when climbing, or losing grip in weight-lifting or gymnastics, sometimes but not always limestone-chalk, often magnesium carbonate (MgCO 3 ).
( US , military , countable ) A platoon -sized group of airborne soldiers .
( US , sports , chiefly basketball , horse racing ) The favorite in a sporting event.
( US , sports , chiefly basketball ) The prediction that there will be no upsets, and the favored competitor will win.
